author: MicronDRAM
body:
I am making a shopping list of names to buy, but I am going to do it by selling puts to capitalize on high IV.

• MU earnings next week. Book value is ~ $33. I am looking to sell the $35p for next week and hope that I get assigned with a cost basis around $31.75.

• DIS. I’ll be honest, I don’t know how to value this name. All their growth is from acquisitions and they have a lot of debt. Disney + is fine, but $5/month should have never made this a $140 stock. I may start nibbling at shares, but haven’t made up my mind yet.

• SBUX. This will probably drop more. Selling the $45p next week gives you a cost basis of ~ $43.50. I like the stock here. Another name that will never go away.

• HD. Im shocked to see it this low, but makes sense as people aren’t rushing to renovate homes in they’re getting laid off. I missed the boat on this stock, so I’d like to start building a position.

• WEN. I know the growth isn’t there, but I sold 2x $8p’s today. If I get assigned, fine by me.

• XLK around $65

• AMD around $28 if we get there

author: PregnantMale
body:
You do realize that college kids sign 1 year leases with the housing apartments right? This generally means last year Aug -> July this year. Students not being able to sublease literally doesnt impact apartment housing companies because they already signed a contract. And by the time college starts back up again, the new wave of students will go right into the housing and companies like ACC won't even notice a penny missing on their balance sheets. 

tl;dr im a cuck and you shouldnt listen to me. MU 90C Jan 2021

author: m2845
body:
MU just had earnings. Significant source of uncertainty of their future has just been removed from the market with a release of their latest earnings. As you get further away from this most recent release of information, uncertainty grows until the next quarterly release. Likely IV will rise until that time unless other macro events or other news about this stock provide more certainty about the direction of this company, then the IV rise will likely still happen but be more muted.

Other examples of this, if there are major pending litigation against a company or phase III drug trials within the next X months anticipated, will also see a inflated IV for that particular stock and not for the overall market. For example in the phase III trials, when the results of that get released IV drops due to less uncertainty. That is very likely regardless of if its a big positive move or big negative move or no move at all. Although you'll see less of an IV loss of value of the contract if you're in the money, have bought in an expiration time frame significantly out (3 months or more), or if the movement is in your direction (or some combination of all of these, and probably some other factors I'm forgetting about like spread or liquidity of the contracts).

Macro does play a part too as I mentioned earlier, and IV is down market wide as well today with the release of the unemployment numbers.

author: crjlsm
body:
Nope, you're right. We totally blew it with containment, and that will begin to become apparent by next week. 

Haven't heard much about it in south america, but they're due for a surge in cases as well. Supply chains are gonna get mega fucked. Also China has been at 60% for like 2 weeks now. People are hoping they are back at 100% by mid march but at this rate it wont be until april or later. 

Basically just take what happened in wuhan. For like 3 weeks it was spreading unchecked with officials trying to save face. (We, along with Britain and the EU are here) then, there was an explosion of cases that began to overwhelm the system (SK and Italy are getting here) and then it was total lockdown. Still is total lockdown, btw. SK has already locked down some cities and italy I believe is considering it. Not saying we will have total quarantine here stateside, but I wouldn't be shocked if Seattle, LA, or NYC went into partial lockdown. This will most likely be bad for MU
